context/6: She knows nothing further about her husband's disappearance.

context: Oh, there was a motive all right.
context/1: Wonder what the motive could be?
context/2: Doesn't seem to make sense somehow.
context/3: And now we've got two sets of killing and no reason at all.
context/4: He wouldn't make two mistakes.
context/5: Well, of course it's no good now.
context/7: He made a mistake, thought he was killing somebody else, went to the wrong house or something.
context/9: I thought maybe the reason why there seemed to be no reason was because there isn't any reason.
